title: High Risk of Impoverishing Expenditure for Surgical Care
description: In 2022, 100% of Burundi's population was at risk of impoverishing expenditure for surgical care, indicating a significant financial burden on citizens seeking medical treatment.

title: Severe Stunting in Children Under 5
description: As of 2024, 52.8% of children under 5 in Burundi suffer from stunting, with a higher prevalence in males (56.6%) compared to females (49.1%).

title: High Female Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2023, 92.02% of female employment in Burundi was in agriculture, highlighting the sector's critical role in providing jobs for women.

title: Predominance of Agricultural Employment
description: By 2023, 85.05% of Burundi's total employment was in agriculture, underscoring the sector's importance to the national economy.

title: High Male Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2023, 77.60% of male employment in Burundi was concentrated in agriculture, reflecting the sector's dominance in the job market for men.

title: Limited Access to Clean Cooking Fuels
description: In 2022, only 0.1% of Burundi's population had access to clean fuels and technologies for cooking, with urban access slightly higher at 0.2%.

title: Low Internet Usage Among Females
description: As of 2017, only 1.5% of the female population in Burundi used the internet, indicating limited digital connectivity.

title: Minimal Investment in Energy
description: In 2023, Burundi attracted just $1,000,000 in private investment for energy projects, highlighting a need for increased energy sector investment.

title: Low GDP Per Capita
description: Burundi's GDP per capita was $193 in 2023, one of the lowest globally, reflecting economic challenges.

title: Limited Banking Access
description: In 2020, there were only 12.16 depositors per 1,000 adults in Burundi, indicating limited access to banking services.

title: Low Employment in Industry
description: In 2023, only 3.07% of Burundi's total employment was in the industrial sector, suggesting limited industrial development.

title: Low Educational Attainment for Males
description: By 2017, only 22.7% of males aged 25 and older had completed primary education, indicating educational challenges.

title: Minimal Specialist Surgical Workforce
description: In 2018, Burundi had only 0.4 specialist surgeons per 100,000 population, reflecting a shortage in healthcare professionals.

title: Low GNI Per Capita
description: In 2023, Burundi's GNI per capita was $220, one of the lowest globally, highlighting economic constraints.

title: Low Employment in Services
description: As of 2023, only 11.88% of Burundi's total employment was in the service sector, indicating limited service industry growth.
